==Chinese==

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}}: a woman with breasts kneeling or standing. In modern form turned on left side: enclosed area is remnant of left breast (character's left, depicted woman's right), while right breast has disappeared. Graphically cognate to {{zh-l|母|mother}}, which has developed similarly, but also includes dots for nipples and has retained both breasts.

{{zh-forms|alt=𠨰}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|おみな|yomi=k}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=おみな}}. {{IPAchar|/womi<sub>1</sub>na/}} → {{IPAchar|/womina/}} → {{IPAchar|/omina/}}. The initial {{IPAchar|/wo/}} expressed "small, youth" and contrasted with {{IPAchar|/o/}} "grown, old" (as in {{m|ja|嫗|tr=omina}} "old woman"). The medial {{IPAchar|/mi/}} is cognate with {{m|ja|女|tr=me||female, woman}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|おみな|acc=0|acc_ref=NHK|acc2=1|acc2_ref=NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おみな|hhira=をみな}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=おみな|archaic}} a [[young]] [[woman]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=おみな|archaic}} a woman

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|おんな|yomi=k}}
From earlier {{IPAchar|/womina/}}: {{IPAchar|/womina/}} → {{IPAchar|/woɴna/}} → {{IPAchar|/oɴna/}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|おんな|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おんな|hhira=をんな}}

# a [[woman]]

=====Usage notes=====
This has superseded ''omina'', and is now one of the standard Japanese words for {{m|en|woman}}.

=====Antonyms=====
* {{ja-r|男|おとこ}}: [[man]], [[male]]

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|め|yomi=k}}
